official-title.#text:
To amend title 38, United States Code, to require the
		  reporting of cases of infectious diseases at facilities of the Veterans Health
		  Administration, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following bill; which was referred to
			 the

short-title.#text:
Department of Veterans Affairs Disease
			 Reporting and Oversight Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Requirement that
			 Veterans Health Administration report cases of infectious diseases at
			 facilities of the Administration

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is amended by adding at the end the
			 following new section:

, not later than 24 hours after the director of a Veterans
				Integrated Service Network confirms the presence of a notifiable infectious
				disease at a facility under the jurisdiction of the director, the director
				shall submit notice of such presence to the following:

text.#text: Except as provided in
The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the Centers for
				Disease Control and Prevention

text.#text: The

The State in which the facility is
				located and if the State has an agency or department that handles matters
				relating to such notifiable infectious disease, the head of such agency or
				department.

The county in which the facility is
				located and if the county has an agency or department that handles matters
				relating to such notifiable infectious disease, the head of such agency or
				department.

For each individual who has contracted
				the notifiable infectious disease at the facility or is at risk of contracting
				such notifiable infectious disease—

the individual and the individual's
				next of kin;

the individual's primary health
				care provider; and

the county in which the
				individual resides and if the county has an agency or department that handles
				matters relating to such notifiable infectious disease, the head of such agency
				or department.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
who is
				employed at such facility.

is located requires that a notifiable infectious
				disease confirmed at such facility be reported to the State more quickly than
				required under

or requires that a suspected presence of a
				notifiable infectious disease at such facility be reported before waiting for
				confirmation of such presence, the director concerned shall comply with such

text.#text:
If the State in which a facility
				described in

text.#text:
Not later than 24 hours after
				submitting a notice under

For purposes of this section, a notifiable
				infectious disease is any infectious disease that is—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
;
				or
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

text.#text:
on the list of
				nationally notifiable diseases published by the Council of State and
				Territorial Epidemiologists and the

covered by a
				provision of law of a State that requires the reporting of infectious
				diseases.

Not
				later than seven days after the director of a Veterans Integrated Service
				Network confirms the presence of a notifiable infectious disease at a facility
				under the jurisdiction of such director, the director shall develop and
				implement an action plan to manage and control the potential spread of the
				notifiable infectious disease.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall also provide details on the role of partnering
				Federal, State, and local government entities in the management and control of
				the potential spread of the notifiable infectious disease.

text.#text:
The plan developed and implemented
				under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for a
				period of not less than 10 years.

text.#text:
The director of each Veterans Integrated Service Network
				shall keep records of each notice submitted under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to

a report on the
				compliance of the directors of the Veterans Integrated Service Networks with
				the requirements of this section.

text.#text: Not less frequently than once each year, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
suspects that a director of a Veterans
				Integrated Service Network has failed to comply with an applicable provision of
				this section, the Inspector General shall conduct an investigation to determine
				whether such director failed to comply with an applicable provision of this
				section.

text.#text: In any case in which the
